intro: Psychotria moseskemei, commonly known as Moses' psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
